Insert mode should be disabled for views or custom SQL
description:
Currently Ctrl+N allows entering insert mode even for views and custom SQL queries, which doesn't make sense since:
- Views are typically read-only (or have complex insert rules)
- Custom SQL queries don't represent a specific table to insert into

The insert mode trigger (Ctrl+N at tui_keybindings.go:104) should check e.relation.IsView and e.relation.IsCustomSQL and show an error message instead of enabling insert mode.

title: Editor.buffer size should not be based on viewport height
description:
The circular buffer (Editor.buffer) is currently initialized to tableDataHeight (viewport height) at tui_core.go:247. This couples data management with display concerns.

Issues:
- Small terminals get small buffers, limiting scrolling performance
- Terminal resize doesn't update buffer size
- Circular buffer should be sized for performance, not display

The buffer should be a fixed constant (e.g., 100-1000 rows) independent of viewport height.

Related code:
- tui_core.go:247 - buffer initialization
- tui_core.go:155 - tableDataHeight calculation
- tui_commands.go:362 - commented out similar issue with 'why???' note
